citation.article-title: Anaerosporobacter mobilis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Anaerosporobacter (An.a.e.ro.spo.ro.bacâ€²ter. Gr. pref. an- without; Gr. n. aer air; Gr. n. spora a seed, and, in biology, a spore; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Anaerosporobacter an anaerobic, spore-forming, rod-shaped bacterium).
Gram-positive, endospore-forming, strictly anaerobic, mesophilic and neutrophilic rods.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Various sugars, including glucose, are fermented.
The major end products from glucose are formate, acetate and H2.
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but gelatin is not.
The type species is Anaerosporobacter mobilis.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the XIVa cluster of the low-G+C Clostridiales group (Collins et al., 1994).
